required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Angeliq and Prempro on Blood Pressure and Sodium Sensitivity in Postmenopausal Women With Prehypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Double Blind, Randomized, Active-control Study to Evaluate Effects of Drospirenone/Estradiol (Angeliq) and Medroxyprogesterone Acetate/Conjugated Equine Estrogen (Prempro) on Blood Pressure and Sodium Sensitivity in Postmenopausal Women With Prehypertension

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to compare the effects of treatment of two different formulations of Angeliq® and Prempro on blood pressure in post-menopausal women with prehypertension.

detailed_description.textblock: This study has previously been posted by Berlex, Inc. Berlex, Inc. has been renamed to Bayer HealthCare Pharmaceuticals, Inc.Bayer HealthCare Pharmaceuticals, Inc. is the sponsor of the trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hour SBP From the Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM) Measurements in Full Analysis Set (FAS) Population
primary_outcome.description: The mean change in 24-hr ambulatory systolic blood pressure (SBP) from Baseline to Week 8 was calculated for the full analysis set. The change from baseline means was adjusted for center and baseline SBP.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hour SBP From the ABPM Measurements in Per Protocol Population
primary_outcome.description: The mean change in 24-hr ambulatory systolic blood pressure (SBP) from Baseline to Week 8 was calculated for the per protocol (PP) population. The change from baseline means was adjusted for center and baseline SBP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hour DBP From the ABPM Measurements
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change in 24-hr Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) from Baseline to Week 8 was calculated for the full analysis set.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Office Cuff SBP and DBP at Trough
secondary_outcome.description: Seated systolic and diastolic office cuff blood pressures were taken at each visit; the mean of three readings were used at each timepoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean Day Time, Mean Nighttime and Mean Trough SBP From the ABPM Measurements
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure means were calculated during the intervals daytime (6 AM - 10 PM); nighttime (10 PM - 6 AM), and trough (mean of last 5 measurements in the 24-hour cycle)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean Day Time, Mean Nighttime and Mean Trough DBP From the ABPM Measurements
secondary_outcome.description: Diastolic blood pressure means were calculated during the intervals daytime (6 AM - 10 PM); nighttime (10 PM - 6 AM), and trough (mean of last 5 measurements in the 24-hour cycle)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Are Sodium Sensitive at Baseline and Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Sodium sensitivity was defined as ≥ 10 mmHg drop in mean arterial pressure, calculated from the office cuff BP values from Day 1 to Day 3. The number of subjects shifting from sodium sensitive at Baseline to sodium resistant at Week 8 or sodium resistant at Baseline to sodium sensitive at Week 8 by treatment group was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hours ABPM SBP Values, Baseline Mean > 112 mmHg (Posthoc Analysis)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean 24-hour ABPM SBP values were calculated in posthoc subgroup analyses for the following subgroups: Baseline mean 24-hour SBP from ABPM >112 mmHg, >116 mmHg, >120 mmHg, >124 mmHg, and >130 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hours ABPM SBP Values, Baseline Mean > 116 mmHg (Posthoc Analysis)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean 24-hour ABPM SBP values were calculated in posthoc subgroup analyses for the following subgroups: Baseline mean 24-hour SBP from ABPM >112 mmHg, >116 mmHg, >120 mmHg, >124 mmHg, and >130 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hours ABPM SBP Values, Baseline Mean > 120 mmHg (Posthoc Analysis)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean 24-hour ABPM SBP values were calculated in posthoc subgroup analyses for the following subgroups: Baseline mean 24-hour SBP from ABPM >112 mmHg, >116 mmHg, >120 mmHg, >124 mmHg, and >130 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hours ABPM SBP Values, Baseline Mean > 124 mmHg (Posthoc Analysis)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean 24-hour ABPM SBP values were calculated in posthoc subgroup analyses for the following subgroups: Baseline mean 24-hour SBP from ABPM >112 mmHg, >116 mmHg, >120 mmHg, >124 mmHg, and >130 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hours ABPM SBP Values, Baseline Mean > 130 mmHg (Posthoc Analysis)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean 24-hour ABPM SBP values were calculated in posthoc subgroup analyses for the following subgroups: Baseline mean 24-hour SBP from ABPM >112 mmHg, >116 mmHg, >120 mmHg, >124 mmHg, and >130 mmHg.

arm_group.description: 0.5 mg drospirenone/1.0 mg 17β-estradiol for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)
2.0 mg drospirenone/1.0 mg 17β-estradiol for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)
1.5 mg medroxyprogesterone acetate/0.3 mg conjugated equine estrogen for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

intervention.description: SH K 00641 A -Active study medication encapsulated tablet
SH K 00641 B - Active study medication encapsulated tablet

intervention.intervention_name: SH K 00641 C - Medroxyprogesterone acetate / conjugated equine (Prempro TM)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Postmenopausal women 45 - 65 years old with prehypertension
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hormone therapy (estrogen/progestin)

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subject enrollment began on 16-Jan-2007 and lasted over a period of 6 months at 10 study centers in the U.S. There was no enrollment at 2 sites (108 and 110). Site 102 enrolled 14 subjects and site 105 enrolled 56 subjects (28 of whom consented to the sodium sensitivity analysis). All other sites enrolled 7 or fewer subjects.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Screening involved office cuff BP measurements at 3 visits to evaluate prehypertension. Of the 178 enrolled, 86 subjects were screen failures. The full analysis and safety sets had 90 subjects who took at least 1 dose of study medication (2 subjects did not confirm if they ever took the study medication).

group.title: 0.5mg DRSP / 1.0mg E2 (Angeliq, BAY86-4891)
group.description: 0.5 mg drospirenone/1.0 mg 17β-estradiol for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

group.title: 2.0mg DRSP / 1.0mg E2 (Angeliq, BAY86-4891)
group.description: 2.0 mg drospirenone/1.0 mg 17β-estradiol for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

group.title: 1.5 mg MPA / 0.3 mg CEE (Prempro)
group.description: 1.5 mg medroxyprogesterone acetate/0.3 mg conjugated equine estrogen for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

participants_list.participants: 1 subject did not confirm if she ever took the study medication.
1 subject did not confirm if she ever took the study medication.

group.description: 0.5 mg drospirenone/1.0 mg 17β-estradiol for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

group.description: 2.0 mg drospirenone/1.0 mg 17β-estradiol for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Smoking history
measure.description: Subjects smoking more than 10 cigarettes per day were excluded from the study.

measure.title: Baseline ambulatory blood pressure
measure.description: 24-hour mean Ambulatory blood pressure monitoring (ABPM) values at the Baseline visit.

measure.title: Baseline cuff blood pressure
measure.description: The baseline SBP was to be between 130 and 139 mmHg and DBP ≤ 89 mmHg. The mean SBP values from 2 of the 3 consecutive office cuff measurements during the screening visits were to have been within 12 mmHg and the mean DBP values within 8 mmHg to confirm stability of the blood pressure.

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Height, body weight, and arm circumference were measured at the screening visit and body weight was measured at the screening, treatment phase, and follow-up visits. The same scale was used for all body weight measurements. BMI was measured in kg/m^2.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hour SBP From the Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM) Measurements in Full Analysis Set (FAS) Population
outcome.description: The mean change in 24-hr ambulatory systolic blood pressure (SBP) from Baseline to Week 8 was calculated for the full analysis set. The change from baseline means was adjusted for center and baseline SBP.
outcome.population: Primary analysis used Full Analysis Set (FAS), which follows ITT principles; no imputation methods used; patients with missing data had no Blood Pressure (BP) values after baseline

group.title: 0.5mg DRSP / 1.0mg E2 (Angeliq, BAY86-4891)
group.description: 0.5 mg drospirenone/1.0 mg 17β-estradiol for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

group.title: 2.0mg DRSP / 1.0mg E2 (Angeliq, BAY86-4891)
group.description: 2.0 mg drospirenone/1.0 mg 17β-estradiol for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

group.title: 1.5 mg MPA / 0.3 mg CEE (Prempro)
group.description: 1.5 mg medroxyprogesterone acetate/0.3 mg conjugated equine estrogen for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hour SBP From the Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM) Measurements in Full Analysis Set (FAS) Population
measure.description: The mean change in 24-hr ambulatory systolic blood pressure (SBP) from Baseline to Week 8 was calculated for the full analysis set. The change from baseline means was adjusted for center and baseline SBP.
measure.population: Primary analysis used Full Analysis Set (FAS), which follows ITT principles; no imputation methods used; patients with missing data had no Blood Pressure (BP) values after baseline

analysis.groups_desc: Pairwise comparisons among all three treatment groups were performed; both DRSP / E2 group vs MPA /CEE, and the two active doses against each other. Null hypotheses were that there were no differences between groups for each of the three pairwise comparison. Analysis of variance model was used, with terms for treatment, center, and baseline BP values.
analysis.p_value_desc: 0.5 mg DRSP / 1.0 mg E2 vs 1.5 mg MPA / 0.3 mg CEE.
analysis.method_desc: No adjustments made for multiple comparisons

analysis.groups_desc: Pairwise comparisons among all three treatment groups were performed; both DRSP / E2 group vs MPA /CEE, and the two active doses against each other. Null hypotheses were that there were no differences between groups for each of the three pairwise comparison. Analysis of variance model was used, with terms for treatment, center, and baseline BP values.
analysis.p_value_desc: 2.0 mg DRSP / 1.0 mg E2 vs 1.5mg MPA / 0.3 mg CEE.
analysis.method_desc: No adjustments made for multiple comparisons

analysis.groups_desc: Pairwise comparisons among all three treatment groups were performed; both DRSP / E2 group vs MPA /CEE, and the two active doses against each other. Null hypotheses were that there were no differences between groups for each of the three pairwise comparison. Analysis of variance model was used, with terms for treatment, center, and baseline BP values.
analysis.p_value_desc: 0.5 mg DRSP / 1.0 mg E2 vs 2.0 mg DRSP / 1.0 mg E2.
analysis.method_desc: No adjustments made for multiple comparisons

outcome.population: Primary analysis was Per Protocol Population (PP); no imputation methods used; patients with missing data had no BP values after baseline.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Who Are Sodium Sensitive at Baseline and Week 8
outcome.description: Sodium sensitivity was defined as ≥ 10 mmHg drop in mean arterial pressure, calculated from the office cuff BP values from Day 1 to Day 3. The number of subjects shifting from sodium sensitive at Baseline to sodium resistant at Week 8 or sodium resistant at Baseline to sodium sensitive at Week 8 by treatment group was reported.
outcome.population: FAS subjects from the one site which performed the sodium sensitivity analysis

group.title: 1.5 mg MPA / 0.3 mg CEE (Prempro)
group.description: 1.5 mg medroxyprogesterone acetate/0.3 mg conjugated equine estrogen for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Mean 24-hours ABPM SBP Values, Baseline Mean > 130 mmHg (Posthoc Analysis)
measure.description: Mean 24-hour ABPM SBP values were calculated in posthoc subgroup analyses for the following subgroups: Baseline mean 24-hour SBP from ABPM >112 mmHg, >116 mmHg, >120 mmHg, >124 mmHg, and >130 mmHg.
measure.population: FAS population, for patients with baseline 24-hour ABPM means > 130 mmHg

group.title: 0.5mg DRSP / 1.0mg E2 (Angeliq, BAY86-4891)
group.description: 0.5 mg drospirenone/1.0 mg 17β-estradiol for 8 weeks (8 weeks plus 3 days for sodium sensitivity subjects)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: (A). PI will provide copy to Sponsor sixty (60) days. Sponsor will have thirty (30) days to review and provide feedback. (B). If proposed publication presents material adverse effect on Sponsor's confidentiality information, then PI shall delay or prevent such publication. (C) In multi-center trial, the investigative data will be pooled and published as a collaborative effort with consent from all parties including the Sponsor.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Small sample size, as this was a pilot study.
